SEARCH
Module objectos.code
Package objectos.code

Interface ClassTypeName

All Superinterfaces:
ArrayTypeComponent, BlockInstruction, ClassOrParameterizedTypeName, ConstructorDeclarationInstruction, ExecutableDeclarationInstruction, ExpressionPart, ExtendsClauseInstruction, FieldDeclarationInstruction, ImplementsClauseInstruction, Instruction, MethodDeclarationInstruction, ParameterInstruction, ReferenceTypeName, StatementPart, TypeName, VariableInitializer
public sealed interface ClassTypeName extends ClassOrParameterizedTypeName, ArrayTypeComponent, ExpressionPart, ExtendsClauseInstruction, ImplementsClauseInstruction
Represents the fully qualified name of a class or interface type in a Java program.

To create instances of this class use one of provided factory methods:

  • of(Class)
  • of(String, String, String...)
  • of(ClassTypeName, String)
Since:
0.4.2

  • Method Details

    • of

      static ClassTypeName of(Class<?> type)
      Creates a new ClassTypeName from the provided Class instance.

      A ClassTypeName instance can only represent a class or an interface type. Therefore, this method throws a IllegalArgumentException when the specified type:

      • represents a primitive type;
      • represents an array type; or
      • is the void.class literal.

      This method is typically used to initialize a static field: 

       static final ClassTypeName STRING = ClassTypeName.of(String.class);

      Which then can be used: 

       method(
   PUBLIC, STRING, name("toString"),
   p(RETURN, s("Objectos Code"))
 )

      And, in turn, it generates: 

       public String toString() {
   return "Objectos Code";
 }
      Parameters:
      type - the Class object whose name will be used in a Java program
      Returns:
      a newly constructed ClassTypeName instance
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if type represents either a primitive type, an array type, or void.

    • of

      static ClassTypeName of(String packageName, String simpleName, String... nested)
      Creates a new ClassTypeName from the provided names.

      The following code illustrates how to create names using the method: 

       // creates the name for the java.lang.String type
 static final ClassTypeName STRING =
     ClassTypeName.of("java.lang", "String");

 // creates the name for the java.util.Map.Entry nested type
 static final ClassTypeName ENTRY =
     ClassTypeName.of("java.util", "Map", "Entry");
      Parameters:
      packageName - the name of the package
      simpleName - the name of the top level type
      nested - the additional names that make up the name of this nested type
      Returns:
      a newly constructed ClassTypeName instance
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if any name in packageName is not a valid identifier, if simpleName is not a valid identifier or if any name in nested is not a valid identifier

    • of

      static ClassTypeName of(ClassTypeName enclosing, String simpleName)
      Creates a new ClassTypeName by nesting the provided simpleName into the provided enclosing name.

      The following code illustrates how to create names using the method: 

       // creates the name for the java.util.Map type
 static final ClassTypeName MAP =
     ClassTypeName.of("java.util", "Map");

 // creates the name for the java.util.Map.Entry nested type
 static final ClassTypeName ENTRY =
     ClassTypeName.of(MAP, "Entry");
      Parameters:
      enclosing - the enclosing class name
      simpleName - the name to be immediately nested into enclosing
      Returns:
      a newly constructed ClassTypeName instance
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if simpleName is not a valid identifier

    • simpleName

      String simpleName()
      Returns the simple name.
      Returns:
      the simple name
      Since:
      0.4.4
